DOC.brief_summary: This study aims to compare the results of skin testing and ELISPOT assay in patients with a history of non-immediate reactions to cephalosporins
DOC.brief_title: Skin Testing and ELISPOT Assay in Patients With a History of Non-Immediate Reactions to Cephalosporins
DOC.detailed_description: Patients with a history of non-immediate reactions to cephalosporins will be tested by patch test and/or intradermal test. Peripheral blood mononuclear cells will be collected to analyzed cytokine secretions by ELISPOT assay
DOC.mesh_term: Drug-Related Side Effects and Adverse Reactions
DOC.criteria: 1. Patients with a history of nonimmediate hypersensitivity reactions to cephalosporins 2. At least 18 years of age 1. Suffering from severe systemic disease/ in bad health 2. Being pregnant 3. Patients with a history of immediate reactions to cephalosporin
